page.title: 01Solihull - Local History
page.content: Two small settlements were mentioned in the original Domesday Book,{ {Ulverlei}and{Langedone. { }Later Ulverlei was moved by its Lord to a new site on top of a muddy or{ {soily hill}overlooking the important crossroads between the roads from Birmingham to Warwick and Droitwich to Coventry. From{Soily Hill}come{Solihull}and the{old town}of Ulverlei became known as{Olton}an area on the edge of the modern town. Very little happened in Solihull until very recently. 1930 saw the beginning of its rapid rise in political importance to its present status of Metropolitan Borough.
